For recipe/meta.yaml.noarch: python recipes should almost always follow the syntax in our documentation. For the host section of the recipe, you should almost always use python  for the python entry. For the run section of the recipe, you should almost always use python >= for the python entry. For the test.requires section of the recipe, you should almost always use python  for the python entry. You may need to override the python_min variable in the conda_build_config.yaml/variants.yaml if the package requires a newer Python version than the currently supported minimum version on conda-forge.

python recipes should almost always follow the syntax in our documentation. For the host section of the recipe, you should almost always use python  for the python entry. For the run section of the recipe, you should almost always use python >= for the python entry. For the test.requires section of the recipe, you should almost always use python  for the python entry. You may need to override the python_min variable in the conda_build_config.yaml/variants.yaml if the package requires a newer Python version than the currently supported minimum version on conda-forge.

name: caldav
raw_meta_yaml:
For recipe/meta.yaml:

    noarch: python recipes should almost always follow the syntax in our documentation. For the host section of the recipe, you should almost always use python {{ python_min }} for the python entry. For the run section of the recipe, you should almost always use python >={{ python_min }} for the python entry. For the test.requires section of the recipe, you should almost always use python {{ python_min }} for the python entry. You may need to override the python_min variable in the conda_build_config.yaml/variants.yaml if the package requires a newer Python version than the currently supported minimum version on conda-forge.


{% set name = "caldav" %}
{% set version = "1.4.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/caldav-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 4317131127d8793f740cff2fd256f369321fa49ad750f83d6f31780f7c16c67b

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - vobject
    - lxml
    - requests
    - icalendar
    - recurring-ical-events >=2.0.0
    - pytz
    - tzlocal

test:
  imports:
    - caldav
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://github.com/python-caldav/caldav
  summary: CalDAV (RFC4791) client library
  license: GPL-3.0-only AND Apache-2.0
  license_file:
    - COPYING.APACHE
    - COPYING.GPL

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - tdido
